bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to R. Hart Phillips, April 22, 1948

div1.p: Hench thanks Phillips for helping him to acquire copies of aerial photographs, and requests the name and address of the man who took the original photographs.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to R. Hart Phillips, April 22, 1948
div1.opener:
April 22, 1948
Mrs. R. Hart Phillips
Manana de Gomez
Habana, Cuba
My dear Mrs. Phillips:
div1.p:
You certainly were a great help to me on my recent visit to Cuba,
more of a help than you realize. I have been extremely anxious to get air
plane pictures of the location in Quemados which is historically related to
the Conquest of Yellow Fever. As I wrote you, I have been unable to get
these anywhere after a long search. I had thought myself of asking the Cuban
Air Force to take the pictures but just didn't have the nerve bwithout your
encouragement. Doctor Nogueira of Quemados, took me to meet first the medical
officers at Ciudad Militar and then the Air Force officers. They were ex-
tremelynkind and promptly arranged to have the pictures taken for me. How-
ever, when the pictures were not forthcoming after several days, I looked up
Antonio Perez Benitoa as you suggested. He was most courteous and hunted
around and found eight fairly good air views. He most kindly loaned these
to me and I had them copied here. They were really pretty good. However, if
you can find the name and address of the man who took the original films, I
should still like to get in touch with him and borrow the originals which are
always much clearer than copies. Didn't you think his name was Leo Hamburg?
I would certainly appreciate your further help in this matter.

Since my return, the Army air views arrived. One is especially
good and I am delighted indeed to have them. Even so, I should like to locate
the original films taken by Mr. Hamburg.

When, in the course of human events, I finish my book, it will be a
real pleasure for me to express my indebtedness to you by sending you a copy
which you can use as a door stop or a paper weight or for any other purpose
which seems agreeable.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
